description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability in the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server affecting various Windows builds:

1. Download and install the appropriate updates for your system from the Windows Update catalog:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64-based Systems): KB5035853
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64-based Systems): KB5035853
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64-based Systems): KB5035854
   - For Windows 10 (x64-based Systems): KB5035858
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit Systems): KB5035858
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64-based Systems): KB5035845

2. Restart your system after the installation to ensure changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This fix resolves an integer overflow or wraparound vulnerability (CWE-190) in the OLE DB provider which could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely.
- For manual installation, the update packages can be found here:
   - [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
   - [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)
   - [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
   - [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that your system matches one of the specified build numbers before updating.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
